header.title: شمس المعارف الكبرى ولطائف العوارف
header.category: Western Esotericism, Occultism, Grimoire Tradition, Islamic Magic, Sufi Mysticism

central_thesis: The book asserts that understanding the divine names (Asma al-Husna) and their inherent esoteric properties, including numerical values, letter correspondences, and spiritual applications, allows for practical manipulation of reality, both for spiritual advancement (connection to the divine presence) and worldly desires, without hardship. It emphasizes the interconnectedness of God's names, Qur'anic verses, and the letters of the alphabet, forming a comprehensive system of operative magic and mysticism.

structure_content.summary: Introduces the book's purpose: to reveal the honor of God's names, their inherent wisdom, and methods for spiritual and worldly attainment through divine names, Qur'anic letters, and verses.

Discusses the benefits of specific prayers and recitations (e.g., 'Subhan Allah al-Azim') for worldly sustenance, relief from poverty, and protection, linking them to angelic practices and prophetic traditions.

structure_content.chapter_title: الفصل الخامس عشر في الشروط اللازمة لبعض دون بعض في البدايات والنهايات
structure_content.summary: Explores the creation of angels, the esoteric meaning of the divine name 'Al-Quddus' (The Holy), and its manifestations in the higher spiritual realms. It sets a foundational understanding of divine attributes.

structure_content.chapter_title: فصل (على Essence of Unity in Surah Al-Ikhlas)
structure_content.summary: Analyzes the metaphysical implications of 'Qul Huwa Allahu Ahad' (Say: He is Allah, [who is] One), emphasizing divine oneness, self-sufficiency, and its profound connection to other divine names and attributes, considered the essence of unity.

structure_content.chapter_title: فصل في ذكر ترجيح لا اله الا الله على سائر الكلمات وتبيين مرتبة الصمدية على سائر السور والآيات
structure_content.summary: Argues for the supreme importance of 'La Ilaha Illa Allah' (There is no god but Allah) as a gateway to divine realization. It stresses the necessity of spiritual discretion ('secrecy in knowledge') and the concept of 'Kashf' (unveiling) through detachment from the ego ('dying to self').

Delves into the esoteric power of Arabic letters and numbers, their connection to celestial forces, and their application in alchemy and angelic operations. It highlights the inherent numerical and spiritual values of each letter.

structure_content.chapter_title: الفصل التاسع والخمسون في اسمه تعالى مبدىء
structure_content.summary: Analyzes the divine name Al-Mubdi' (The Originator), detailing its numerical value (56), letter correspondences, and practical applications for initiating new endeavors, gaining wisdom, and attracting blessings. It links the name to manifestation and creation.

structure_content.chapter_title: الفصل التاسع عشر في أسماء الله الحسنى وأوفاقها النافعات
structure_content.summary: Commences a detailed analysis of the 99 Divine Names (Asma al-Husna), providing their meanings, numerical values, letter correspondences, practical applications for various needs (e.g., protection, sustenance, love, authority, healing), and specific talismanic constructions (Wafaqat).

structure_content.chapter_title: الفصل السابع عشر في خواص كهيعص وحروفها الربانيات الاقدسيات
structure_content.summary: Provides a deep, technical analysis of the mystical letters K-H-Y-'A-S, including their individual properties, numerical values, and applications in specific rituals and talismans for protection, binding tongues, and evocation of spirits.

structure_content.chapter_title: Chapter on Ayatul Kursi (Verse of the Throne)
structure_content.summary: Explains the profound protective and beneficial properties of Ayatul Kursi, detailing various methods of recitation, talismanic uses, and applications for healing, protection, and influencing others.

Highlights the benefits of Surah Ya Sin for various needs, providing specific invocations and methods for its use in spiritual and worldly achievements, emphasizing its power for blessings and resolution of difficulties.
This section outlines practical applications involving combinations of divine names within a specific grid, designed for attracting blessings, protection, and various forms of success.

structure_content.chapter_title: الفصل السابع عشر في خواص كهيعص وحروفها الربانيات الاقدسيات (continuation)
structure_content.summary: Further elaborates on the divine and sacred letters K-H-Y-'A-S, H-M-'A-S-Q, and Q-W-N, detailing their profound esoteric properties and practical applications in operative magic for achieving various objectives.

key_concepts.definition: The 99 Most Beautiful Names of Allah, each possessing unique esoteric properties, numerical values (abjad), and spiritual vibrations, used as tools for specific magical operations and spiritual attunement.

Geometric squares or triangular matrices inscribed with divine names, numbers, and letters, designed to harness specific planetary or elemental energies for desired outcomes. These are crafted according to precise numerological and astrological rules.
Each Arabic letter possesses an inherent divine power, numerical value (abjad), and elemental correspondence, which are fundamental to the system of crafting talismans and invocations.
The numerical values of letters and names, used for constructing wafaqat, determining auspicious timings for rituals, and understanding hidden correspondences and energetic flows.

A period of intense spiritual discipline involving seclusion, fasting, and rigorous recitation (dhikr), undertaken to purify the practitioner, prepare the self for operative magic, and achieve spiritual unveiling (kashf).
Repetitive chanting of divine names, specific Qur'anic verses, or sacred phrases to attune the practitioner to particular divine attributes and energies, often performed a prescribed number of times.

The direct perception or unveiling of hidden spiritual realities, esoteric knowledge, or divine insights that become accessible to the practitioner through dedicated spiritual practice and purification.
Subtle divine inspirations, intuitions, or inner thoughts received during spiritual practice, which guide the practitioner or reveal hidden truths.

The elemental natures (fiery, earthy, airy, watery) assigned to letters, names, planets, and individuals. These correspondences are crucial for tailoring magical operations to align with appropriate energetic conditions.

Specific invocations, often lengthy and complex, containing divine names and sacred phrases, used to compel spiritual entities (angels, jinn, elemental spirits) to appear or assist in magical operations.
Specific periods within the day or night governed by planetary influences. These are considered astrologically auspicious for performing particular magical operations to enhance their efficacy.
A personal spiritual companion, often linked to an individual's nature. The system describes methods to influence, control, or benefit from this spirit for magical purposes.
Spiritual entities, including angels and planetary intelligences, associated with divine names and celestial spheres, whose assistance is sought and directed in magical operations.

practical_system.description: The system described in Shams al-Ma'arif al-Kubra is a comprehensive operative magical framework. It centers on the 99 Divine Names (Asma al-Husna), each imbued with unique numerical values (abjad) and letter correspondences. Practitioners undergo rigorous spiritual retreats (riyada) involving seclusion, fasting, and intense, repetitive recitations (dhikr) of specific divine names or Qur'anic verses, often thousands of times. This purification process aims to attune the practitioner to divine energies. The core operative technique involves creating 'wafaqat' (magical grids or talismans) by inscribing specific divine names, their numerical values, and associated letters on various materials (e.g., paper, metals, animal skin). These inscriptions must be performed at astrologically auspicious times (planetary hours, lunar phases) to harness specific celestial influences. These talismans are then activated and used for a wide array of intentions, including attracting love, wealth, protection, healing, influencing authorities, or performing spirit evocation. The rituals often combine talismanic work with specific prayers (du'a) and sometimes fumigation (bakhur).
tools: Wafaqat (Magical Grids/Talismans): Inscribed geometric squares or matrices containing divine names, letters, and numbers.
Pen/Ink: Traditional inks such as saffron ink, musk ink, rosewater ink, or other specific herbal inks, for writing on talismans.

Materials for Talismans: Diverse materials including paper (white, colored), various metals (gold, silver, copper, lead), glass, animal skin (e.g., gazelle skin), bone, clay, or wax, chosen based on the ritual's purpose.
Incense (Bakhur): Aromatic substances like luban (frankincense), aloeswood, musk, jasmine, rose, ambergris, and specific tree leaves or woods for fumigation.
Water: Rosewater, pure river water, or spring water used for washing talismans (for drinking or bathing) or as a ritual component.
Oil: Olive oil or various aromatic oils used for anointing the body, talismans, or ritual objects.
Containers: Cups, jars, bowls, or specific ritual vessels for mixing inks, holding water, or containing talismans.
Clothing: Clean, pure, and often white garments worn during rituals to symbolize purity and facilitate spiritual receptivity.
Astrological Almanacs: Texts or charts used to determine the most auspicious planetary hours, lunar mansions, and planetary dignities for performing rituals.
Ring/Seal: Specific rings or seals inscribed with divine names or symbols, worn by the practitioner or used to seal talismans.
Seclusion Space: A ritually purified, clean, quiet, and isolated location (e.g., a room, cave) for conducting riyada and complex rituals.
rituals: Recitation (Dhikr): Repetitive chanting of specific Divine Names or Qur'anic verses (e.g., Ayatul Kursi, Surah Al-Ikhlas, Surah Ya Sin), performed a prescribed number of times (hundreds to thousands), tailored to the desired outcome.

Riyada (Ascetic Practice): Periods of seclusion, fasting (often involving dietary restrictions), and spiritual purification (e.g., 7, 21, or 40 days), abstaining from worldly pleasures and social interaction.

Talismanic Construction (Wafaqat): The intricate process of creating magical grids or squares by inscribing letters, numbers, and divine names onto various materials, adhering to precise numerological and astrological guidelines.

Fumigation (Bakhur): The burning of specific incenses (e.g., frankincense, sandalwood, musk, aloeswood, various herbs) during rituals to create a conducive energetic atmosphere, purify the space, or attract specific spiritual entities.

Spirit Evocation/Conjuration ('Azima): Invoking angelic, planetary, or elemental spirits associated with specific divine names or verses to compel their assistance in magical operations, often involving elaborate oaths and commands.
Dream Incubation: Performing specific rituals and recitations before sleep to induce dreams that provide guidance, insights, or reveal hidden information.
Healing Rituals: Utilizing specific divine names, Qur'anic verses, and talismans for physical and spiritual healing, often involving writing and washing the talisman for consumption or application.
Tongue Binding: Rituals designed to silence adversaries, prevent harm from enemies, or gain favor and acceptance from authorities, often involving inscribed talismans or specific recitations.

Astrological Timing: Performing rituals and constructing talismans during specific planetary hours, lunar phases, or other astrologically auspicious times to align with celestial influences and maximize efficacy.

relevant_quotes.text: المقصود من هذا الكتاب أن يعلم بذلك شرف أسماء الله تعالى وما أودع في بحرها من أنواع الجواهر الحكميات وكيف التصريف بالاسماء والدعوات وما تابعها من حروف السور والآيات ليتصل بها إلى الحضرة الربانية من غير تعب ويتصل بها الى رغائب الدنيا بلا نصب انتهى
اعلم وفقني الله واياك لطاعته وفهم أسرار أسمائه أن الله تعالى خلق الملائكة الحاملين العرش والحاملين الكرسى والمتصرفين عن القلم والمصفحين اللوح وجعل لهم أنواعا من الاذكار واختلاف تعبدات

واعلم أن كل اسم من أسماء الله تعالى اذا كانت حروفه وترا فانه يصلح للتفريق والتشتيت وان كان شفعا فانه يصلح للتأليف والازدواج والمحبة * واعلم أن كل اسم له حروف وأعداد ولكل عدد وفق فمن جمع من حروف كل اسم وعدد ما في كل وفق من كشف السير و لكل اسم من الأسماء عدد روحاني بطبيعة جسده الهوى المتشكل

اعلم أيها الطالب الصادق والخاطب الراغب أوصلك الله الى كيمياء السعادة الأبدية وسيمياه السيادة السرمدية أن علم الاسماء عسلم شریف نورانی و سر لطیف روحاني عول عليه الاكابر من الأولياء العارفين واعتمد عليه الأفاضل من العلماء كالامام الغزالي والبرازى وهو من العلوم اللدنية في أصله والرسوم الكشفية في وصفه وحقيقة التمسك به والتوجه للطائف ومعارف التجليات الوحدانية الحاصلة لأهل التوجهات الفردانية والمؤثر في كل مالها من القوابل الامكانية والمتصدى له من محققى العلماء العارفين

واعلم أن لكل آية من كتاب الله تعالى حروفا واعدادا ولكل عدد وفق فمن جمع بين حروف آية وعددها في وفق شريف وفق لكشف السرية واعلم أن كل آية لها شكل عند أر باب الاسرار ووفق عند أصحاب الأنوار فاذا نظر الروحاني إلى ذلك الشكل اجاب ومن عرف سر التداخل انفعلت له الاشياء

critical_analysis.relevance: Shams al-Ma'arif al-Kubra is a foundational and highly influential text in Islamic occultism and grimoire traditions, with enduring relevance across the Middle East, North Africa, and extending to Western esotericism through various Hermetic and Qabalistic influences. It details a comprehensive system of operative magic rooted in divine names, Qur'anic verses, and Arabic letter mysticism. The work provides a practical framework for practitioners seeking spiritual advancement, worldly success, protection, healing, and influence over others. Historically, it serves as a primary source for understanding medieval magical practices and their philosophical underpinnings in the Islamic world, predating or paralleling many European grimoires.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The target audience consists of advanced practitioners of Islamic magic, Sufi mystics, scholars of esotericism, and individuals seeking practical methods for spiritual development, worldly success, protection, and healing through divine invocation and talismanic magic. The text explicitly warns against revealing certain 'secrets' to the uninitiated, indicating its intended use by those already on a mystical or magical path.
